intro: Henningia chlorantha, commonly known as the green-flowered heath, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of pale green or white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and horticultural study.
